column1: '''''The Legend of Sigurd and Gudrún''''' is a collection of texts by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] related to the [[Old Norse]] ''[[Wikipedia:Völsungasaga|Völsungasaga]]''
The main part of the book consists of two long poems: ''The New Lay of the Völsungs'' and ''The New Lay of Gudrún''
column2: with commentaries by Christopher Tolkien. The work also includes two shorter
column3: related poems in [[Old English]] and an "Introduction to the 'Elder Edda'" (based on lecture manuscripts) by J.R.R. Tolkien.

column1: Deriving his version primarily from his close study of the ancient poetry of Norway and Iceland known as the Poetic Edda (and from the later prose work the Volsunga Saga)
column2: Tolkien employed a verse-form whose lines embody in English the exacting alliterative rhythms and the concentrated energy of the poems of the Edda.
